Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am syncing a Hush full node with all indexes (txindex, address, timestamp, spent) on the dpow branch, on a notary node for further testing. We are getting closer to having protection against double spend attacks on exchanges (aka 51%/consensus attacks), and our code is an example for other coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Bar_F1sh_Rel> Miningspeed has dropped support for any coin with greater than 1M hash - probably because it's not profitable enough for them (too few coins found with their user base)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> @dukeleto  How many Hush coins z9 mined in 24 hours?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Default z9 frequency is 500, I overclocked mine to 625. So instead of about 10.5 KSol/s default, it gets about 14KSol/s. At current network conditions, that is about 40-45 HUSH per day with a single overclocked z9 mini

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is in a pool, you could also solo mine with your own pool that is just a proxy for your z9 mini

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> then you would earn entire blocks, and a z9 mini can find a few blocks per day itself. That avoids the pool fee, but takes time to maintain the solo mining setup

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Many people are mining ZEN with z9 minis, and can cash out at around $6/day before electricity costs. Hush is more like $5/day, but I think Hush is very under-valued currently and I am mining+HODLing for a brighter future. This bear market makes tiny coins like HUSH very over-sold. Even Komodo is at $1 !!!! That is just madness
